resources.string:
A demo application based on TensorFlow's BERT to perform NLP operations on runtime contents. This app runs completely offline.


Designed and Developed by:
Omkar Phadke

Pellentesque mollis ligula at aliquet vulputate.

Google released mobileBERT (Bidirectional Encoder Representations from Transformers) in 2018 aiming for high performance lightweight Natural Language Processing for processors having limited resources such as those of smartphones. It is based on Tensorflow Lite model which can be used to build a system that can answer users\' questions in natural language. In 2022, Google launched an non-compiled proof-of-concept application on GitHub for showcasing BERT\'s usage on Android smartphones. This app uses the same BERT technology under the hood.

Tap the \"+\" button on home screen of the app to add a topic. Then, enter a suitable title for your text and paste/type in your text content. Tap Save icon. The title of your text will appear in the home screen list. Tap the list item. You can now ask questions based on the text content you had inserted.

Take a note of the following points while you ask questions:

 1. The model cannot generate text on its own. Hence, the results will always be a part of the text you have provided.
 2. Since text generation is not possible, questions like "Summarize the paragraph", "Predict the outcome" or any such similar queries will produce garbage results.
 3. From a list of results, top 5 results are shown, where first is most likely and 5th is least likely.
 4. Try phrasing your questions in such a way, that they end in a question mark and start with a "Wh" type word. For example, instead of asking "Do you know the CEO of Google?" or "Tell me the name of CEO of Google.", ask "Who is the CEO of Google?"

Threads are used to improve performance by allowing multiple operations to run simultaneously. Increasing number of threads might increase computing speed but it depends on number of cores the delegate has.\n A Delegate is a software component that can be used to accelerate the execution of TensorFlow Lite models. Delegates can be used to leverage on-device accelerators such as the GPU (Graphics Processing Unit), CPU (Central Processing Unit), and NNAPI (Android Neural Networks API).
Warning: These settings usually don\'t require alterations. Only proceed if you know what you are doing.

You\'ll need to type in some sentences, and then you can ask questions to get shorter answers from those sentences. Remember, the answers will need to be present in those sentences. This is useful for storing useful information like your identity number, name of your favourite vendor or perhaps where did you park your car before you went to that shop you were trying to go in a while. This way, unlike other apps, you won\'t need to search for exact words. Just ask as if you would ask a person! ðŸ˜ƒ

You can set a safety character limit to your text. This will ensure that your phone will process only so much words that it can handle. This also means that any documents you feed will be split into pieces, with each piece having your set number of characters. You can either let the app choose the best limit for you or you can set it manually. The default limit is 4000 characters. Remember, increasing character limit will allow you to enter more characters, but you will loose precision. Choose a balance which suits you.
Who is called the father of electricity?
